TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed DispatcherPriority extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Describes the priorities at which operations can be invoked by way of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks There is no specific system state or "idleness" corresponding to ApplicationIdle and ContextIdle in the current version of [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)]. Both are still valid priorities; therefore, an operation with a priority of ContextIdle has a higher priority than an operation with a priority of SystemIdle.
The <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority.ApplicationIdle> does not throttle the execution of an operation if it exceeds a certain percentage of the CPU. One way to throttle a process it to use a timer.
If an operation is posted using <xref:System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher.Invoke%2A> on its own <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority.ContextIdle> at a priority of Send, the operation bypasses the queue and is immediately executed.
## Examples The following example is a call to <xref:System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher.BeginInvoke%2A> that passes a delegate which accepts an argument. The priority is set to Normal.
[!code-csharp[ThreadingWeatherForecast#ThreadingWeatherDispatcherOneArge](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ThreadingWeatherForecast/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#threadingweatherdispatcheronearge)] [!code-vb[ThreadingWeatherForecast#ThreadingWeatherDispatcherOneArge](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ThreadingWeatherForecast/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#threadingweatherdispatcheronearge)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority ApplicationIdle = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The enumeration value is 2. Operations are processed when the application is idle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority Background = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The enumeration value is 4. Operations are processed after all other non-idle operations are completed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority ContextIdle = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The enumeration value is 3. Operations are processed after background operations have completed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority DataBind = int32(8)

Docs.summary: The enumeration value is 8. Operations are processed at the same priority as data binding.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority Inactive = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The enumeration value is 0. Operations are not processed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority Input = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The enumeration value is 5. Operations are processed at the same priority as input.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority Invalid = int32(-1)

Docs.summary: The enumeration value is -1. This is an invalid priority.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority Loaded = int32(6)

Docs.summary: The enumeration value is 6. Operations are processed when layout and render has finished but just before items at input priority are serviced. Specifically this is used when raising the Loaded event.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority Normal = int32(9)

Docs.summary: The enumeration value is 9. Operations are processed at normal priority. This is the typical application priority.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority Render = int32(7)

Docs.summary: The enumeration value is 7. Operations processed at the same priority as rendering.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority Send = int32(10)

Docs.summary: The enumeration value is 10. Operations are processed before other asynchronous operations. This is the highest priority.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority SystemIdle = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The enumeration value is 1. Operations are processed when the system is idle.
